project.teaser: The aim of VILLAGE is to re-examine the post-pandemic teaching processes and needs of engineering instructors and students for laboratory practice in a multidimensional, multicultural and multidisciplinary context, and to determine roadmaps for new instructional design models...
project.objective: The aim of VILLAGE is to re-examine the post-pandemic teaching processes and needs of engineering instructors and students for laboratory practice in a multidimensional, multicultural and multidisciplinary context, and to determine roadmaps for new instructional design models in line with the opinions of the stakeholders, to create effective and sustainable instructional models, while developing a pilot virtual lab and its learning materials to test the proposed model. VILLAGE is a joint research and innovation (R&I) project in the context of generating a sustainable learning model for laboratory engineering education considering the new normal and the needs of the instructors with the exchange of staff within partnerships of universities, research infrastructures and SMEs in Europe and beyond, which aims to strengthen inter-sectoral and international collaboration. In general, the existence of some virtual laboratories for engineering education is known, and some variables are effectively used. Beyond the state of the art, this project aims not only to design another virtual lab, but to design a sustainable model for engineering laboratories education based on a multidimensional, multicultural and multidisciplinary analysis.
project.title: Virtual Innovative Learning Laboratories for Global Engineering Education (VILLAGE)
project.keywords: engineering education, instructional design, virtual laboratories

article.title: A new model for engineering laboratories education

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - VILLAGE (Virtual Innovative Learning Laboratories for Global Engineering Education (VILLAGE))
result.teaser: The aim of VILLAGE is to re-examine the post-pandemic teaching processes and needs of engineering instructors and students for laboratory practice in a multidimensional, multicultural, and multidisciplinary context, and to determine roadmaps for new instructional design models...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Project Website
result.description: D 6.2 Project Website (M3, Actionline): A portal presenting the project and used as the key communication instrument, it will also include the learning platform and contents described in WP3.

result.title: Needs analysis report of instructors
result.description: D 2.2 Needs analysis report of instructors (M20, MTU): This report in PDF format includes the raw data and the analysed results of the findings from at least 200 engineering instructors.

result.title: Global State of the art report
result.description: D 1.1 Global State of the art report (M9, EGE): The global state of the art report includes the findings derived from the desk research and focus group analysis in T 1.1 and published open-online.

result.title: Open access database of instructional design models
result.description: The instructional design models database will be published online. It is aimed to list all reachable (at least 15) instructional design models, combine them in a document and create the database.

result.title: Score ranking of instructional design database
result.description: The ranking score survey and the ranked instructional design models will be published online. The ranking score table will be shared and open to everyone for other further studies.

result.title: Requirements and needs analysis methodology
result.description: D 2.1 Requirements and needs analysis methodology (M16, LiepU): This report includes the analysed state-of-the-art methodologies from the literature and the methodology for analysing the needs of instructors and students. The report will be made in PDF format and will be made open source for analysis by the general public.

result.title: Dissemination materials & tools 1
result.description: D 6.3 Dissemination Materials & Tools (M27, EGE): Mix of dissemination materials to be used in the project, which are based upon the visual identity, each with their own delivery date. The initial set of materials identified are (but not limited to): VILLAGE visual identity, website; social media; leaflet; newsletters; press release.

result.title: Report on deficiencies in instructional design models
result.description: The deficiencies of instructional design models according to the new normal necessities will be reported.

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).
